18class AbstractCode;
19class ClosureFeedbackCellArray;

21#include "torque-generated/src/objects/js-function-tq.inc"

23// An abstract superclass for classes representing JavaScript function values.
24// It doesn't carry any functionality but allows function classes to be
25// identified in the type system.
26class JSFunctionOrBoundFunctionOrWrappedFunction
27 : public TorqueGeneratedJSFunctionOrBoundFunctionOrWrappedFunction<
28 JSFunctionOrBoundFunctionOrWrappedFunction, JSObject> {
29 public:
30 static const int kLengthDescriptorIndex = 0;
31 static const int kNameDescriptorIndex = 1;
32
33 // https://tc39.es/proposal-shadowrealm/#sec-copynameandlength
34 static Maybe<bool> CopyNameAndLength(
35 Isolate* isolate,
36 Handle<JSFunctionOrBoundFunctionOrWrappedFunction> function,
37 Handle<JSReceiver> target, Handle<String> prefix, int arg_count);
38
39 static_assert(kHeaderSize == JSObject::kHeaderSize);
40 TQ_OBJECT_CONSTRUCTORS(JSFunctionOrBoundFunctionOrWrappedFunction)
41};
42
43// JSBoundFunction describes a bound function exotic object.
44class JSBoundFunction
45 : public TorqueGeneratedJSBoundFunction<
46 JSBoundFunction, JSFunctionOrBoundFunctionOrWrappedFunction> {
47 public:
48 static MaybeHandle<String> GetName(Isolate* isolate,
49 Handle<JSBoundFunction> function);
50 static Maybe<int> GetLength(Isolate* isolate,
51 Handle<JSBoundFunction> function);
52
53 // Dispatched behavior.
54 DECL_PRINTER(JSBoundFunction)
55 DECL_VERIFIER(JSBoundFunction)
56
57 // The bound function's string representation implemented according
58 // to ES6 section 19.2.3.5 Function.prototype.toString ( ).
59 static Handle<String> ToString(DirectHandle<JSBoundFunction> function);
60
61 TQ_OBJECT_CONSTRUCTORS(JSBoundFunction)
62};
63
64// JSWrappedFunction describes a wrapped function exotic object.
65class JSWrappedFunction
66 : public TorqueGeneratedJSWrappedFunction<
67 JSWrappedFunction, JSFunctionOrBoundFunctionOrWrappedFunction> {
68 public:
69 static MaybeHandle<String> GetName(Isolate* isolate,
70 Handle<JSWrappedFunction> function);
71 static Maybe<int> GetLength(Isolate* isolate,
72 Handle<JSWrappedFunction> function);
73 // https://tc39.es/proposal-shadowrealm/#sec-wrappedfunctioncreate
74 static MaybeHandle<Object> Create(Isolate* isolate,
75 Handle<NativeContext> creation_context,
76 Handle<JSReceiver> value);
77
78 // Dispatched behavior.
79 DECL_PRINTER(JSWrappedFunction)
80 DECL_VERIFIER(JSWrappedFunction)
81
82 // The wrapped function's string representation implemented according
83 // to ES6 section 19.2.3.5 Function.prototype.toString ( ).
84 static Handle<String> ToString(DirectHandle<JSWrappedFunction> function);
85
86 TQ_OBJECT_CONSTRUCTORS(JSWrappedFunction)
87};
88
89// JSFunction describes JavaScript functions.
90class JSFunction : public TorqueGeneratedJSFunction<
91 JSFunction, JSFunctionOrBoundFunctionOrWrappedFunction> {
92 public:
93 // [prototype_or_initial_map]:
94 DECL_RELEASE_ACQUIRE_ACCESSORS(prototype_or_initial_map, Tagged<HeapObject>)
95
96 // [shared]: The information about the function that can be shared by
97 // instances.
98 DECL_ACCESSORS(shared, Tagged<SharedFunctionInfo>)
99 DECL_RELAXED_GETTER(shared, Tagged<SharedFunctionInfo>)
100
101 // Fast binding requires length and name accessors.
102 static const int kMinDescriptorsForFastBindAndWrap = 2;
103
104 // [context]: The context for this function.
105 inline Tagged<Context> context();
106 DECL_RELAXED_GETTER(context, Tagged<Context>)
107 inline bool has_context() const;
108 using TorqueGeneratedClass::context;
109 using TorqueGeneratedClass::set_context;
110 DECL_RELEASE_ACQUIRE_ACCESSORS(context, Tagged<Context>)
111 inline Tagged<JSGlobalProxy> global_proxy();
112 inline Tagged<NativeContext> native_context();
113 inline int length();
114
115 static Handle<String> GetName(Isolate* isolate, Handle<JSFunction> function);
116
117 // [code]: The generated code object for this function. Executed
118 // when the function is invoked, e.g. foo() or new foo(). See
119 // [[Call]] and [[Construct]] description in ECMA-262, section
120 // 8.6.2, page 27.
121 // Release/Acquire accessors are used when storing a newly-created
122 // optimized code object, or when reading from the background thread.
123 // Storing a builtin doesn't require release semantics because these objects
124 // are fully initialized.
125 DECL_CODE_POINTER_ACCESSORS(code)
126
127 // Returns the raw content of the Code field. When reading from a background
128 // thread, the code field may still be uninitialized, in which case the field
129 // contains Smi::zero().
130 inline Tagged<Object> raw_code(IsolateForSandbox isolate) const;
131 inline Tagged<Object> raw_code(IsolateForSandbox isolate,
132 AcquireLoadTag) const;
133
134 // Returns the address of the function code's instruction start.
135 inline Address instruction_start(IsolateForSandbox isolate) const;
136
137 // Get the abstract code associated with the function, which will either be
138 // a InstructionStream object or a BytecodeArray.
139 template <typename IsolateT>
140 inline Tagged<AbstractCode> abstract_code(IsolateT* isolate);
141
142 // The predicates for querying code kinds related to this function have
143 // specific terminology:
144 //
145 // - Attached: all code kinds that are directly attached to this JSFunction
146 // object.
147 // - Available: all code kinds that are either attached or available through
148 // indirect means such as the feedback vector's optimized code cache.
149 // - Active: the single code kind that would be executed if this function
150 // were called in its current state. Note that there may not be an active
151 // code kind if the function is not compiled. Also, asm/wasm functions are
152 // currently not supported.
153 //
154 // Note: code objects that are marked_for_deoptimization are not part of the
155 // attached/available/active sets. This is because the JSFunction might have
156 // been already deoptimized but its code() still needs to be unlinked, which
157 // will happen on its next activation.
158
159 bool HasAvailableHigherTierCodeThan(IsolateForSandbox isolate,
160 CodeKind kind) const;
161 // As above but only considers available code kinds passing the filter mask.
162 bool HasAvailableHigherTierCodeThanWithFilter(IsolateForSandbox isolate,
163 CodeKind kind,
164 CodeKinds filter_mask) const;
165
166 // True, iff any generated code kind is attached/available to this function.
167 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE bool HasAttachedOptimizedCode(
168 IsolateForSandbox isolate) const;
169 bool HasAvailableOptimizedCode(IsolateForSandbox isolate) const;
170
171 bool HasAttachedCodeKind(IsolateForSandbox isolate, CodeKind kind) const;
172 bool HasAvailableCodeKind(IsolateForSandbox isolate, CodeKind kind) const;
173
174 base::Optional<CodeKind> GetActiveTier(IsolateForSandbox isolate) const;
175 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE bool ActiveTierIsIgnition(IsolateForSandbox isolate) const;
176 bool ActiveTierIsBaseline(IsolateForSandbox isolate) const;
177 bool ActiveTierIsMaglev(IsolateForSandbox isolate) const;
178 bool ActiveTierIsTurbofan(IsolateForSandbox isolate) const;
179
180 // Similar to SharedFunctionInfo::CanDiscardCompiled. Returns true, if the
181 // attached code can be recreated at a later point by replacing it with
182 // CompileLazy.
183 bool CanDiscardCompiled(IsolateForSandbox isolate) const;
184
185 // Tells whether function's code object checks its tiering state (some code
186 // kinds, e.g. TURBOFAN, ignore the tiering state).
187 inline bool ChecksTieringState(IsolateForSandbox isolate);
188
189 inline TieringState tiering_state() const;
190 inline void set_tiering_state(IsolateForSandbox isolate, TieringState state);
191 inline void reset_tiering_state();
192
193 // Mark this function for lazy recompilation. The function will be recompiled
194 // the next time it is executed.
195 void MarkForOptimization(Isolate* isolate, CodeKind target_kind,
196 ConcurrencyMode mode);
197
198 inline bool osr_tiering_in_progress();
199 inline void set_osr_tiering_in_progress(bool osr_in_progress);
200
201 // Sets the interrupt budget based on whether the function has a feedback
202 // vector and any optimized code.
203 void SetInterruptBudget(Isolate* isolate,
204 base::Optional<CodeKind> override_active_tier = {});
205
206 // If slack tracking is active, it computes instance size of the initial map
207 // with minimum permissible object slack. If it is not active, it simply
208 // returns the initial map's instance size.
209 int ComputeInstanceSizeWithMinSlack(Isolate* isolate);
210
211 // Completes inobject slack tracking on initial map if it is active.
212 inline void CompleteInobjectSlackTrackingIfActive();
213
214 // [raw_feedback_cell]: Gives raw access to the FeedbackCell used to hold the
216 // feedback_vector, instead use feedback_vector() which correctly deals with
217 // the JSFunction's bytecode being flushed.
218 DECL_ACCESSORS(raw_feedback_cell, Tagged<FeedbackCell>)
219
220 // [raw_feedback_cell] (synchronized version) When this is initialized from a
221 // newly allocated object (instead of a root sentinel), it should
222 // be written with release store semantics.
223 DECL_RELEASE_ACQUIRE_ACCESSORS(raw_feedback_cell, Tagged<FeedbackCell>)
224
225 // Functions related to feedback vector. feedback_vector() can be used once
226 // the function has feedback vectors allocated. feedback vectors may not be
227 // available after compile when lazily allocating feedback vectors.
228 DECL_GETTER(feedback_vector, Tagged<FeedbackVector>)
229 DECL_GETTER(has_feedback_vector, bool)
230 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE static void EnsureFeedbackVector(
231 Isolate* isolate, Handle<JSFunction> function,
232 IsCompiledScope* compiled_scope);
233 static void CreateAndAttachFeedbackVector(Isolate* isolate,
234 Handle<JSFunction> function,
235 IsCompiledScope* compiled_scope);
236
237 // Functions related to closure feedback cell array that holds feedback cells
238 // used to create closures from this function. We allocate closure feedback
239 // cell arrays after compile, when we want to allocate feedback vectors
240 // lazily.
241 inline bool has_closure_feedback_cell_array() const;
242 inline Tagged<ClosureFeedbackCellArray> closure_feedback_cell_array() const;
243 static void EnsureClosureFeedbackCellArray(
244 Handle<JSFunction> function, bool reset_budget_for_feedback_allocation);
245
246 // Initializes the feedback cell of |function|. In lite mode, this would be
247 // initialized to the closure feedback cell array that holds the feedback
248 // cells for create closure calls from this function. In the regular mode,
249 // this allocates feedback vector.
250 static void InitializeFeedbackCell(Handle<JSFunction> function,
251 IsCompiledScope* compiled_scope,
252 bool reset_budget_for_feedback_allocation);
253
254 // Unconditionally clear the type feedback vector, even those that we usually
255 // keep (e.g.: BinaryOp feedback).
256 void ClearAllTypeFeedbackInfoForTesting();
257
258 // Resets function to clear compiled data after bytecode has been flushed.
259 inline bool NeedsResetDueToFlushedBytecode(IsolateForSandbox isolate);
260 inline void ResetIfCodeFlushed(
261 IsolateForSandbox isolate,
262 base::Optional<
263 std::function<void(Tagged<HeapObject> object, ObjectSlot slot,
264 Tagged<HeapObject> target)>>
265 gc_notify_updated_slot = base::nullopt);
266
267 // Returns if the closure's code field has to be updated because it has
268 // stale baseline code.
269 inline bool NeedsResetDueToFlushedBaselineCode(IsolateForSandbox isolate);
270
271 // Returns if baseline code is a candidate for flushing. This method is called
272 // from concurrent marking so we should be careful when accessing data fields.
273 inline bool ShouldFlushBaselineCode(
274 base::EnumSet<CodeFlushMode> code_flush_mode);
275
276 DECL_GETTER(has_prototype_slot, bool)
277
278 // The initial map for an object created by this constructor.
279 DECL_GETTER(initial_map, Tagged<Map>)
280
281 static void SetInitialMap(Isolate* isolate, Handle<JSFunction> function,
282 Handle<Map> map, Handle<HeapObject> prototype);
283 static void SetInitialMap(Isolate* isolate, Handle<JSFunction> function,
284 Handle<Map> map, Handle<HeapObject> prototype,
285 Handle<JSFunction> constructor);
286
287 DECL_GETTER(has_initial_map, bool)
288 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE static void EnsureHasInitialMap(
289 Handle<JSFunction> function);
290
291 // Creates a map that matches the constructor's initial map, but with
292 // [[prototype]] being new.target.prototype. Because new.target can be a
293 // JSProxy, this can call back into JavaScript.
294 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE static V8_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT MaybeHandle<Map> GetDerivedMap(
295 Isolate* isolate, Handle<JSFunction> constructor,
296 Handle<JSReceiver> new_target);
297
298 // Like GetDerivedMap, but returns a map with a RAB / GSAB ElementsKind.
299 static V8_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT MaybeHandle<Map> GetDerivedRabGsabTypedArrayMap(
300 Isolate* isolate, Handle<JSFunction> constructor,
301 Handle<JSReceiver> new_target);
302
303 // Like GetDerivedMap, but can be used for DataViews for retrieving / creating
304 // a map with a JS_RAB_GSAB_DATA_VIEW instance type.
305 static V8_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT MaybeHandle<Map> GetDerivedRabGsabDataViewMap(
306 Isolate* isolate, Handle<JSReceiver> new_target);
307
308 // Get and set the prototype property on a JSFunction. If the
309 // function has an initial map the prototype is set on the initial
310 // map. Otherwise, the prototype is put in the initial map field
311 // until an initial map is needed.
312 DECL_GETTER(has_prototype, bool)
313 DECL_GETTER(has_instance_prototype, bool)
314 DECL_GETTER(prototype, Tagged<Object>)
315 DECL_GETTER(instance_prototype, Tagged<HeapObject>)
316 DECL_GETTER(has_prototype_property, bool)
317 DECL_GETTER(PrototypeRequiresRuntimeLookup, bool)
318 static void SetPrototype(Handle<JSFunction> function, Handle<Object> value);
319
320 // Returns if this function has been compiled to native code yet.
321 inline bool is_compiled(IsolateForSandbox isolate) const;
322
323 static int GetHeaderSize(bool function_has_prototype_slot) {
324 return function_has_prototype_slot ? JSFunction::kSizeWithPrototype
325 : JSFunction::kSizeWithoutPrototype;
326 }
327
328 std::unique_ptr<char[]> DebugNameCStr();
329 void PrintName(FILE* out = stdout);
330
331 // Calculate the instance size and in-object properties count.
332 // {CalculateExpectedNofProperties} can trigger compilation.
333 static V8_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT int CalculateExpectedNofProperties(
334 Isolate* isolate, Handle<JSFunction> function);
335 static void CalculateInstanceSizeHelper(InstanceType instance_type,
336 bool has_prototype_slot,
337 int requested_embedder_fields,
338 int requested_in_object_properties,
339 int* instance_size,
340 int* in_object_properties);
341
342 // Dispatched behavior.
343 DECL_PRINTER(JSFunction)
344 DECL_VERIFIER(JSFunction)
345
346 static Handle<String> GetName(Handle<JSFunction> function);
347
348 // ES6 section 9.2.11 SetFunctionName
349 // Because of the way this abstract operation is used in the spec,
350 // it should never fail, but in practice it will fail if the generated
351 // function name's length exceeds String::kMaxLength.
352 static V8_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT bool SetName(Handle<JSFunction> function,
353 Handle<Name> name,
354 Handle<String> prefix);
355
356 // The function's name if it is configured, otherwise shared function info
357 // debug name.
358 static Handle<String> GetDebugName(Handle<JSFunction> function);
359
360 // The function's string representation implemented according to
361 // ES6 section 19.2.3.5 Function.prototype.toString ( ).
362 static Handle<String> ToString(DirectHandle<JSFunction> function);
363
364 class BodyDescriptor;
365
366 private:
367 // JSFunction doesn't have a fixed header size:
368 // Hide TorqueGeneratedClass::kHeaderSize to avoid confusion.
369 static const int kHeaderSize;
370
371 // Hide generated accessors; custom accessors are called "shared".
372 DECL_ACCESSORS(shared_function_info, Tagged<SharedFunctionInfo>)
373
374 // Hide generated accessors; custom accessors are called "raw_feedback_cell".
375 DECL_ACCESSORS(feedback_cell, Tagged<FeedbackCell>)
376
377 // Returns the set of code kinds of compilation artifacts (bytecode,
378 // generated code) attached to this JSFunction.
379 // Note that attached code objects that are marked_for_deoptimization are not
380 // included in this set.
381 // TODO(jgruber): Currently at most one code kind can be attached. Consider
382 // adding a NOT_COMPILED kind and changing this function to simply return the
383 // kind if this becomes more convenient in the future.
384 CodeKinds GetAttachedCodeKinds(IsolateForSandbox isolate) const;
385
386 // As above, but also considers locations outside of this JSFunction. For
387 // example the optimized code cache slot in the feedback vector, and the
388 // shared function info.
389 CodeKinds GetAvailableCodeKinds(IsolateForSandbox isolate) const;
390
391 public:
392 static constexpr int kSizeWithoutPrototype = kPrototypeOrInitialMapOffset;
393 static constexpr int kSizeWithPrototype = TorqueGeneratedClass::kHeaderSize;
394
395 TQ_OBJECT_CONSTRUCTORS(JSFunction)
396};
397
398} // namespace internal
399} // namespace v8
